newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Cricket-NZ face tough schedule at home and abroad.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-NZ face tough schedule at home and abroad.

text.p: World Cup cricket champions Sri Lanka will play two tests and three one-day internationals in a tour of New Zealand next March, officials said on Wednesday.
New Zealand Cricket said the Sri Lankans would play tests in Hamilton and Wellington and one-dayers in Auckland, Christchurch and Dunedin, following hard on the heels of a tour by England.

New Zealand will also line up against Sri Lanka and Pakistan this November in a one-day champions trophy competition in Sharjah. The team will go one to tour Pakistan, playing two tests and three one-day internationals.
